chargeHist.descr: Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin C Todd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceratio Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Court will allow for Extended Supervision/Probation to be served in any other State through the Inter-State Compact.
Comply with Sex Offender Treatment.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females.
Compliance with Sex Offender Registry.
Not to possess any materials by any media that is deemed to be pornographic or sexually explicit.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint, their families or residences.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Benjamin C Todd in court, in custody, with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has reviewed the supplemental report and has no objections to including the supplemental as part of the psychological evaluation report.  
Attorney Kuhary makes statement as to if today's hearing should be a resentencing or a sentence modification.  State is in agreement.   Parties make additional statements.  Court to hear argument whether Dr. Jurek's report is  relevant to the modification of sentence and if so, arguments as to what the sentence modification should be.  

Attorney Kuhary would like Dr. Jurek to testify as to his report.  Court will allow.  Dr. Anthony Jurek sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of defense.  Cross-examination by defense.  
Attorney Kuhary makes argument.  State makes argument.  
Court hears argument as to whether victim should be allowed to make a statement.  Court will allow victim to make statement.  A.S. makes statement.  

Court rules that the original report is relevant information to a potential sentence modification.  

Attorney Kuhary makes sentencing argument.  State makes argument.  Court will not modify the original sentence imposed 6/17/16'.  Court to vacate the previous order vacating the judgment of conviction and reinstates the original sentence.

Order Denying in Part and Granting in Part the Defendant's Postconviction Motion for a New Sentencing Based on Ineffectiveness of Counsel.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr.
From Redgranite Correctional.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Benjamin C Todd in court, in custody (by Video Conference from Regranite Correctional), with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary by Atty. Huppertz.
Oral Ruling on:
Defense Postconviction Motion - Ineffectiveness of Counsel (Machner).

Court doesn't find there was ineffectiveness of counsel.
However, the court finds the PsychoSexual Evaluation is new evidence.
Court Grants - Defense request for a New Sentencing.
Court will vacate the sentence and JOC.
Defendant to be returned to Waukesha County Jail for purposes of Sentencing.
Court orders the defendant to be held without bail pending sentencing.
Court also orders this matter be reassigned to a different judge for sentencing.
State's Brief In Opposition of the Defendant's Motion for Post-Conviction Relief.

Per Atty Kuhary, he will not be filing a reply brief after State filed their response brief and requests matter be left on for Oral Ruling on 10/6/17. Court will leave Oral Ruling on 10/6/17. Attorney Matthew Huppertz to be appearing for Attorney Kuhary, therefore, will be no oral arguments made.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Benjamin C Todd in court, in custody (OTP'd From RedGranite Correctional), with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.   
Motions filed by defense - Ineffectiveness of Counsel/Machner (Information not being provided to the court at the time of sentencing and requesting a new sentencing) and Stay of Sentence Pending Appeal (Release on Bail Pending Appeal).

Atty. Kuhary requests the court address with the defendant his waiver of attorney client privilege regarding his prior trial counsel (Dennis Coffey) for purposes of this motion.
Court presented colloquy with the defendant his waiver of attorney client privilege regarding his prior trial counsel (Dennis Coffey).
Court finds that the defendant is voluntarily waiving his attorney client privilege regarding his prior trial counsel (Dennis Coffey) for purposes of this motion.

Atty. Kuhary placed on the record a Stipulation of the parties regarding Dr. Jurek's Evaluation/Report.  Parties have agreed  the Evaluation/Report will be admitted and not require testimony of Dr. Jurek.
State is in agreement to the stipulation as placed on the record.
Court approves/accepts the Stipulation and will admit Dr. Jurek's Evaluation/Report.

Witness Called: Attorney Dennis Coffey (prior trial counsel).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Defense to file any reply by:  09/29/17

Defendant to be OTP'd for the next court date.
Court orders the defendant to be produced by: 10/04/17

Matter put over for any additional arguments and oral ruling to the next court date.

State objects and presented arguments to the court.
Atty. Kuhary presented response.
State presented reply.

Court denies - Defense Motion to Stay Sentence Pending Appeal (Release on Bail) - Premature at this time.
Reason placed on the record.
Court signed order denying.
Court will readdress on the next court date.

Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.

 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
Court will allow to be served in any other State through the inter-State compact. 
Sex offender treatment.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females.
Compliance with the Sex Offender Registry.
Not to possess any materials by any media that is deemed to be pornographic or sexually explicit.
Not to use or access the internet by any means without prior approval of the agent.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint their families or residences.
DNA sample to be provided.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
 Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.   




Count 3:
Total Prison:  3.5  Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5  Years.
Extended Supervision: 2
Consecutive to:  Count 2
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow to be served in any other State through the inter-State compact. 
Consecutive to:  Count 2.

Same as count 2.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waived.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.   




Count 4:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
Concurrent to:  Count 3 & Count 5.
Costs:  $243

Count 5:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
Concurrent to:  Count 3 & Count 4.
